Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Let me in.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What are you doing up, kiddo?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: I don't like my room.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You'll get used to it. It's only your first night.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: What are you looking at?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Just some photos.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: What photos?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Do you know who that is?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: That's me.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: It doesn't look like you.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I know. I'm so happy there. But it's me. When I was your age. I was a kid once too, you know.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: No, you weren't.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Thanks. Maybe you're right...I don't remember being this person at all. I hope she smiled like that all the time, whoever she was.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: I don't wanna grow old.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Well, it starts happening to us from the moment we're born.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: He smells like smoke.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yeah...good memory. He did smoke that god awful pipe, didn't he?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Show me a picture of dad when he was a little kid.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't even know if we have any. He's hopeless with keeping photos.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Show me a picture of me when I was a little kid.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Your pictures are all in the computer. Nobody keeps photo albums like this anymore, they're ancient relics. They should. I like being able to touch something, instead of it floating around in cyber world. If the laptop breaks, your whole existence is erased.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: What was I like when I was a little kid?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You are a little kid.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Billing department.

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: I need a bowl, mom.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Billing department.

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: It's too small.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Make it work.  Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent. Speak to an agent.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Every time I think I've pulled you out...you grow back in.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Well, I'd like to keep the old number if I could.  You really need to learn how to do this, honey.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Don't eat on the floor, buddy.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Okay, well, please let me know by the end of today, I have to give the number out. Thank you.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: How come you were up so early? Was Cali crying?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You woke me up.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You were snoring.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No I wasn't.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yes you were.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't snore.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yes you do.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: My father snored. I do not snore.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: How would you know what you do? You're asleep.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Yes! I made it to the last level! Invisiworld!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Good one, champ.  I don't snore, do I?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Where are my bleeping pills?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What the heck is this? Wax?!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Let me get this straight - we have no actual fruit but we have wax fruit?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: That is dangerous. It could kill one of our kids.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Where are my pills, Josh?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Probably where you left them, Renai.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: That's not where I left them.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Mom, I need my lunch.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Oh, geez. Look, just...take last night's dinner.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Sushi? Aw, that's weirdo food.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: It's all we have. Just for today, honey.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Check it first, Dalton. It's probably made out of Styrofoam.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: And while I've got you, if you're going to look at my books, please don't leave them all over the floor.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: I didn't touch your books.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I gotta go.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Are you taking the boys to school?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No time.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Well can you pick them up after school?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Not today.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: But I have stuff I wanted to...

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: Can I have another cup, mom?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Alanso, please sit down.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: No entiendo.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Sintate, por favor.

Speaker: teri
Dialogue: You better all shut up.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Thank you, Teri. Today we are going to talk about Darwin. It's a city in Australia, but it's also the last name of which famous naturalist?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Correct. Does anybody know what he is famous for?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Half right. He wrote a seminal book that explained his theories on natural selection, and how the different species on this planet - including humans - evolved.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: I know I didn't evolve from no monkey. Shit.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Humans actually have a lot in common with monkeys, or more specifically, chimpanzees.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: Maybe you do, but I was created in the image of my Dios.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I respect your right to believe that, Alanso. But I want to give you all possible theories. I want this class to go out into the world with an informed opinion.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: The theory is incorrect, Mr. Lambert.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: How can it be incorrect? It's a theory. A scientific theory.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: Yeah, well, science is bullshit. We didn't get here cos of no test-tubes.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Alanso, if you keep talking like that I'm going to ask you to visit the principal.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm looking west, always been looking that way, gonna get it all happening, just can't do it today...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Look at this. Nice job.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Josh, where's the box of my lamps?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't know. They should be here. We packed them up.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yeah, I packed them. They're not here.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I remember the movers bringing them in and putting them right there.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Well, they're not here. I would know, I've been unpacking this stuff all day.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Dalton? Where are you?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Dalton?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: I fell.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Dalton, you have to be careful. You shouldn't be coming down here in the dark.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Where do you hurt the most?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: My knee and my head. I can't stand up.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You scared us, champ.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You're lucky you don't need stitches.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: If I catch you falling down the stairs again I'm gonna break your neck.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: That doesn't make sense.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Sleep tight, honey.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: We've gotta lock that door.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: He's such a boy. He goes off exploring. Sometimes I wanna keep him on one of those child leashes.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Why bother with a child leash? I'll stop at the pet store tomorrow.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I'm sorry I was pissy when you got home. I was trying to work on a song today and then Cali woke up and wouldn't stop crying...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I didn't even notice.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I feel guilty for wanting my own time.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: It's normal to want your own time.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Is it? My mother gave up everything for me. I keep waiting for the completely selfless parent gene to kick in, but I'm exactly the same person I was when I was 22, only now I'm married with kids.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You're a great mother.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: No, I'm not. They like you so much better than me.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: That's not true.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You're the cool dad who comes home with presents and I'm the one who yells at them all day.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Now you're being crazy. They love you. At least you get to connect with them. I work so much.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Believe me, you're their hero. They try to play us off against each other. They're master manipulators. I guess they really are my kids.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Is this so bad?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Thank you for letting me take some time off to work on my music again.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: We'll get by. I want you to do it.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: There's a couple of songs...I mean not all of them, but there's a couple of them that I think are really good. And I think, maybe I could do something with them.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I love all your songs.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Foster, sit down honey.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Time to get up, my man. Come on.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: So...there's no brain damage or...?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: That fall he took...I mean, it looked like he hit his head pretty hard.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: He can't just not wake up...there's got to be something...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: So what do we do now? Does he stay here?

Speaker: adele
Dialogue: Are you having any more trouble with the feeding tube?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: It's okay.

Speaker: adele
Dialogue: Alright, well I'll be back soon. I'll bring some new books. You're probably sick of the ones you have.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Did he respond to any of the tests?

Speaker: adele
Dialogue: No...no, he didn't. But we have to give it time. I've seen coma patients with a much longer inactivity time suddenly start making noises.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: He's not in a coma, remember? They don't know what to call it. They don't know what to do with him so they've given up.

Speaker: adele
Dialogue: No, they haven't. We're going to figure it out.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: They see us...all of us...we have to be quick...this life begs us to come back.

Speaker: cali
Dialogue: Dadda!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: She said dad...

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What's this?

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: An award.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: That's today's date. You got this today?

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: I'm scared, mom.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Scared of what?

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: Dalton.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: We're all scared. It's normal to be scared for him. But we can't give up--

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: Why do I have to sleep so close to him? Can't I change rooms?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Why would you wanna change rooms?

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Your brother needs you. Goodnight honey.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Something happened today. I didn't want to tell you in front of Foster.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I heard something coming from Cali's room. A man's voice. On the baby monitor...it scared the hell outta me. I went in there and no one was there.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Could it have been interference?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't know. It was so clear. I was sitting at the piano and I heard this...whispering on the baby monitor. So I held my ear up to it--

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Who the hell is that?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Hello? Who's there?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Who was it, Josh?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: There's someone in there!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Grab Cali and Foster!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Josh! The laundry!

Speaker: security officer
Dialogue: There's no one in there, it's all clear. If someone was there, they're gone now.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I saw somebody.

Speaker: security officer
Dialogue: Maybe it was a shadow...?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: No. It wasn't a shadow, it was a man. He was tall, and he long, greasy hair. He was wearing a grey jacket. He looked right at me.

Speaker: security officer
Dialogue: Well, like I said...he's gone now.

Speaker: photographer
Dialogue: Okay, face the front ladies and gentlemen...come on...hold still...  I'm trying to record the peak of your pathetic lives here.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Uh...what?

Speaker: photographer
Dialogue: Could you step in so that we can take the photo? Quickly please.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Just take it without me.

Speaker: photographer
Dialogue: We need you in the photo, sir.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No, you don't. Just take the damn photo without me, okay?

Speaker: photographer
Dialogue: I can't believe this is my life.  Ready kids? Say asshole teacher!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: I spend so much time in the office, I hear things. I heard about your son. I'm sorry.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Thank you, Alanso.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: Times like these...people realize that science doesn't have all the answers. There is a higher force at work.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I wish I had your belief. Things would be a lot simpler.

Speaker: alanso
Dialogue: Things are simple. You just can't see it. Put your faith in Him.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Hey...I just found out I have to stay back tonight and finish off mid-term grades. It could be a while, there's a lot to go through. Don't wait up. Bye.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: The men all walked down to the waters edge...and they stood there and asked the beast to come forth. And the beast roared back "No!". And so they dived in after it...

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: I was going to head off for an hour or so. Are you alright here?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Of course. Anything from Dalton?

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: No. I'm sorry.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I won't, I just...I haven't slept much the last couple of nights. I feel like the universe is trying to see how far I can bend before I break.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: The universe picked a fight with the wrong chick.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Thanks, Kelly. You're a saint.

Speaker: kelly
Dialogue: No, I'm not. I'm doing my job. I chose to be here. You didn't choose any of this. You're the strong one.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What are you doing up?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: It's midnight, Josh.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: When did you start smoking?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You've been coming home late every single night. You've never had to do that in all of the years you've been at the school. Now all of a sudden you have to stay back late?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't like it either, but I'm grading tests. What choice do I have? We've gotta pay Dalton's bills.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Your mother is paying Dalton's bills, Josh. I know because she reminds me every chance she gets.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Jesus, I can't win with you. That's my son in there too, not just yours!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You're projecting that onto me. You've written an entire story about I'm how I'm feeling without once asking me how I'm feeling.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't need to ask. I know you.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I am losing my mind here in this house, Josh. I'm scared and I need you and you're not here. Where are you?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I told you, I'm grading tests.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't mean that. I mean you're not here. With me. In this situation. You're avoiding it, like you do anything stressful, whether it's this or a parking ticket.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Christ, I should have stayed at the school.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: There you go again.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Jo....osh....Josh....Josh...

Speaker: man
Dialogue: DON'T YOU FUCKING DARE!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What is it? What is it?!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: The man -- he was there -- he tried to -- there was a man there!!!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: There's no one here.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I saw somebody!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: There's no one here.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Don't you dare not believe me!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I believe you, okay? I just don't know what you want me to do.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I want you to tell me that we can leave this house. I will not spend one more night here. I wanna leave, I wanna go!

Speaker: foster
Dialogue: I don't want the man to get me.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You're okay, buddy. I've got you.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I'm sorry.  I can't...I want to leave this house. I can't be here anymore.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: To move now would be...we would have to rent somewhere. It's not--

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Please, Josh.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Lorraine, you shouldn't have to do any of this. Sit down.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Nonsense. I'm perfectly capable of putting a few things away. I did it for Josh his whole life. He never was good with tidying up.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I know, but I just feel so bad.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: I think it's you who should be sitting down by the looks of it.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I can't believe we're doing all this again, that's what I can't believe.  I know you think I'm crazy.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Nobody - not me, not anybody - knows what you're going through right now. Whatever you have to do to get through it, do it. And never apologize for it.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: We just wanna say...thank you so much. For helping us out with this, doctor. We can't tell you how much it means to have you involved.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: So...if you're the top of the food chain with this stuff, where does that leave us?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: So there's hope?

Speaker: tiny tim
Dialogue: Oh tip-toe, from the garden, by the garden, of the willow tree...

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Oh my God, Dalton...no...

Speaker: ned
Dialogue: Josh...didn't see you there.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Sorry to scare you.

Speaker: ned
Dialogue: What are you up to this late?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Where did all the bartenders who listen to your troubles go, Ned?

Speaker: ned
Dialogue: Never drink alone. If you take the dirty jokes out of drunkenness, all you're left with is the self loathing.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't need whisky for that.

Speaker: ned
Dialogue: Bah. You people think too much. Used to be, if life threw a shitstorm at you, you'd grab the nearest umbrella. Your generation would spend a day googling what brand to buy.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I probably would too.  Now I'm the guy whose son is in a mysterious coma.

Speaker: ned
Dialogue: Things happen to everybody. Even to good people like you. And they're gonna keep happening the older you get, believe me. No use sittin' in the dark drinkin' over it. Go home. Be with your wife. Tell her your what's on your mind.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: This is the first line of a joke. Guy comes home to find his wife with a priest...

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Josh, this is Liam Nathanson. A very old friend of mine.

Speaker: father nathanson
Dialogue: Nice to meet you. I've heard a lot about you.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Can't say I've heard the same, Liam. At least I know you're not sleeping with her.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What is going on here?

Speaker: father nathanson
Dialogue: I should be going. Thank you so much for the tea.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Thanks, Liam.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Okay, would anyone mind telling me what the hell is going on here?

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Please sit down, Joshua.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: "Joshua?" Oh Jesus...

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Sit down.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: The melodramatic way in which you two are conducting yourselves right now is scaring the shit out of me, so just tell me what's wrong.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Nothing is wrong. We want to talk.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Nobody asks you to sit down unless something is wrong. If a doctor calls you into his office and asks you to sit down, you're fucked.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: There's no use, Lorraine. He's been drinking.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I have not been drinking. Not enough that we can't talk to each other, Renai. And don't judge me in that bitchy tone, okay?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: He would never speak to me like that before.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Christ. You're acting like I'm some lush who comes home and beats you with a belt. At least I'm speaking to you. You suddenly have to speak to a priest. Or my mother who, up until a couple of weeks ago, you couldn't stand.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You're an asshole.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Your wife needs you. Now sit down and listen to her. I won't ask you again.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: This...thing that was in the other house. It followed us.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: Let her speak.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I saw someone again today. In the house. It looked like a young boy. I followed it into Dalton's room... but it wasn't a child.  This thing is here. I know it.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: So...what? You called in a priest to get rid of it?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I didn't know what else to do.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Are you kidding me?  Was this your idea?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: No. It was mine.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You've never been to a church in your life. Now you're inviting a priest into our home? I feel like I don't even know you right now.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I'm scared.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: This is a fantasy, and you need a therapist, not a member of the clergy.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I told you...

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: What's happening to Renai is real. I've seen it for myself.  I came here today because last night I had a dream about this place.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: I can still hear that voice.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: He's here.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Help us...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't know how.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: I know somebody who can help...if you're willing to ask for it.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: So you must be Josh?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: That wasn't psychic. Lorraine told me your name.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Oh.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: I'm Specs.  I'm here to solve your problem. I'm just kidding with the voice. We take this very seriously.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: So is Elise coming or...?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: She won't be joining us yet. Usually we handle all the background stuff, then she gets involved when we have the facts.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Helps weed out the nutjobs.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Okay...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: This is a little uncomfortable. Speaking for myself. I'm not used to this kind of stuff.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: We understand completely. Ninety six per cent of the people we deal with have had no experience with this type of phenomena before.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Ah...sure.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: My assistant will check different areas of the house for electrical anomalies. I'll get him started. Tucker, would you follow me?

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Assistant?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Could you not eat that in front of the clients?

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Assistant?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Finish it in here. This industry gets laughed at enough as it is.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Do you or any of your children suffer from epilepsy or autism?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: No. I mean, our son...

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Right. I heard about this from Lorraine. He is in a coma, the cause of which is unknown?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Do either of you habitually use drugs or alcohol?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: No drugs at all?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I take anti-depressants sometimes.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Do you have a history of clinical depression?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Not a history. I've had bouts of it. In the past.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Tucker, could you check the camera?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Whenever you're ready then.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: He handles administration, I handle technical. It's an even split. He couldn't change a light bulb and I'm no good with paperwork. It bores me senseless.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Do you have any history of sexual abuse in the family?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No.  I'm sorry, I have to ask how this relates to our problem?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Nine times out of ten, when someone comes to us with a problem like this, it's because of an inward cause within the family unit...not a physical force outside of it.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Tri-field meter. It measures DC fields and the natural electro magnetic environment.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Sometimes old wiring can leak into the atmosphere. It can cause hallucinations, changes in energy.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Yeah. It's a little more complicated than that, but, you know, you get the general idea.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: It's basically that.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Not really, but whatever.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: The tech stuff's not relevant to you anyway.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: It's very relevant, but it's all good.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Epilepsy in one of the children mostly. It's very common. If we approach things academically, it lets us find the genuinely interesting cases.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: I think we can call Elise now...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Mrs. Rainier?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: No, my mother couldn't come, it's just me. Elise. You must be Lorraine's son? You've grown since I last saw you.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Last saw me?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Your mother and I have been friends for a long time.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Hi. I'm Renai.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Pleased to meet you. I'm Elise.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: We took Tri-field and EMF readings of the whole house. All the wiring, alarm clocks, radios, toasters, TV, record player, fuse box. Nothing went off the charts.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: And the previous home?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Tucker hadn't monitored that yet. I could jump on that this afternoon if you like? Make up for lost time.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Yeah, but who would work the equipment? I'll need to be there. You know what, don't even sweat it. I'll make myself available.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: No, that's fine, gentlemen.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Yes. Of course.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Steven, do you have your sketchbook?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Yes, I do. Yes, I do. Yes, yes. I do.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Good. We're going to need it.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What is it for?

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: She tells me what she sees and I draw it. It's the most important part of her process.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: His drawings and my photos comprise her visual records.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Especially the drawings.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: That's debatable.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: It's not debatable.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: It is, but whatever.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Onwards and upwards. Find me a ghost.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: There is something here.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: This is where I saw it.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: ...long hair...grey dress...her eyes are...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Go ahead.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Maybe you could wait back there?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Leave the lights off.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What is it? What do you see?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I'm not sure if you are ready to hear this yet...but unfortunately I can't waste any time easing you into it. There is no time left.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Go on.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Your son...is not in a coma. His physical body is here, but his spiritual body is not.  The reason these disturbances followed you to a new home is because...it is not the house that is haunted. It is your son.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't understand...

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Have you ever heard of astral projection?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Out of body experiences?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I call them travellers. These are people with the ability to leave their physical body and travel to different places in an astral form. To some degree, we all have the ability to do it...but most of us subconsciously suppress it or don't know how to access it.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Lost? Lost where?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: In The Further.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: The Further is that place beyond our perception, beyond our understanding of the physical world that we can see and touch. It is a place without clocks or measurements, without past or future...an infinite realm that holds all of our dreams...and all of our nightmares.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: How many are there?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: There are five benevolent spirits. Five different entities for whom Dalton has become a most prized possession. They are trying to get inside his physical body...and they get closer with each passing day.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Is there a way to bring Dalton back?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: There is something we could try. A way of calling him back. I would need your complete trust.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No. No. This has gone too far.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You said that you'd give her a chance!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I have given her a chance, and I did that because I wanted to help you. But I cannot have somebody telling us that the reason our son is in a coma is because his soul is floating off somewhere in another dimension.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I know this is hard to hear.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No, it's not fair is what it is. You're preying on people's grief and vulnerability, which is really easy to do in a situation like this.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Why did we go to all the trouble of bringing them here if you're just going to reject what they say?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Because I wanted to help you. To put your mind at ease, and if this helped, then great. But to drag Dalton into this? No.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Josh, you're not being fair...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Fair? How did the voice of reason become the bad guy here? Don't you see? You want to believe. Of course you do, honey, anybody would.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: You never believed me...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Honey, I'm on your side. But I genuinely think this is dangerous and frankly, a little exploitative.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: We reject more cases than we take. We're not out for money, sir.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I know, I know...look, I appreciate your interest and your time. I do. Thank you. Thank you very much.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I completely understand. And I honestly don't blame you for reacting like this.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: No, please...don't go.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Thank you for your time.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Look at me for a second, honey.  Look at me.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Do you think I don't want to believe in that stuff? Of course I do. It would make life a lot easier if I did. If I believed that some supernatural force was responsible for what's happened to our son...

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't believe anything anymore, Josh. I used to. I used to believe that I could keep my children safe. I used to believe everything would be okay. To believe in something, you have to know it to be true.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Where are you? Where did you go?  Can you hear me? I'm begging you to show me that you can hear me...I don't know how to help you. Please tell me what to do.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: What's most important is that you realize no two attempts are the same. I will be completely honest with you about the results, and if no dialogue is established, I will tell you. I am not in the business of embellishing success. What happens, happens.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: These still cameras are rigged to pick up changes in the atmosphere, electrical or temperature-wise. Don't be alarmed if they go off.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Everything I say while I am in tune will be at a very low volume, so you won't hear any of it. Steven will write it down and repeat it for you.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: We are calling out to you Dalton.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Leave this vessel! Leave this vessel!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Dalton!

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: I feel like a mountain climber who's been waiting his whole life to climb Everest, and now that I'm standing on the summit, I don't know what to do with myself...

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: I'll tell you what we do with ourselves. We make a short list of our preferred media outlets, that's what.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Oh my God...

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: After all the years we've been dining out on morsels like a faucet that turns itself on and off...we finally have some empirical evidence of the real thing. Proof.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Proof? Proof of what? Nine tenths of the world believes that when you die, your soul ascends to sit with God. Would you be telling them something they didn't already know?

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: That is so not the point. This is not about religion. Here we have irrefutable evidence of a paranormal experience. Our job is to share it.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: No, our job is not to alert the press and prove the existence of the `paranormal', as you call it. I'm not out to prove anything. I've known there was a higher plane ever since I was a little girl and I could play hopscotch with people whose names were inscribed on tombstones. What you call paranormal is a fact of life for me.  Our job is to help people. The least we can do is spare them the indignity of Sixty Minutes.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Yeah, until they get their book deal...then you'll wish you'd listened.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: No, I won't, Tucker. I'll just be proud of you. You two stared down something that would crush most mortals tonight and you stood tall.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: So what do we do now?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: We answer the door.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Mom...what are you doing here?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I asked your mother to come over. I called her immediately after...the session. I told her to hurry over.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: There is something we must talk about. Sit down, Lorraine.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Tell me what?

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: The reason...I knew to call Elise in this situation...the reason I know her so well...is because I called her myself once. Years ago.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: It's no accident that your son is such a gifted traveller. The ability was handed down to him.  By his father.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: No...I've never...done that before.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: When you were about eight...you suffered night terrors. Awful fits of pure fear. You were terrified of an old woman who you said would come to visit you at night.

Speaker: old woman
Dialogue: Let me in.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: I dismissed your stories. Told you to grow up.  Then I saw her for myself.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I don't...I don't remember any of this...

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: You've blocked it out.  But in the back of your mind, you're still afraid of having your picture taken, aren't you?

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: I've kept the photos hidden ever since then...until tonight.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I advised Lorraine to hide them. To stop taking your picture. And to let you forget.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Who is she?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: A parasite. She befriended your astral body, then drew you out into The Further, just as Dalton has been drawn out.

Speaker: lorraine
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Josh.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: I didn't want to make you remember this...I only do it for the sake of your son.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: How long do we have before...that thing...takes him over completely?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: If you cannot reach him tonight, then he is gone forever.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Remember who you are and why you are traveling. Keep one foot in this world.  Are you ready?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I want you to know something...you have never been less than good enough for me. You've always been perfect for me. You're my best friend...my soulmate. I love you so much.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I love you too. I have since the first time you looked at me. I don't exist without you.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Close your eyes, Josh...and relax. Breathe deeply. Let all life around you fade out into the background...until the only thing you can hear is the ticking of the metronome.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: This is useless...I have no idea what I'm doing and you just suddenly expect me to...

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Keep your guide, and a steady stride...and into The Further you go.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: He's in...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Dalton?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Dalton?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Where is Dalton?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Do you know where Dalton is?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Why do I have to put up with you? What a tramp. You call this a home? I work all day for this?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Dalton? Where are you?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I'm looking for my son, Dalton.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: DALTON!!!! WHERE ARE YOU?!!!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: DALTON!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: DALTON!!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What's happening to him?!

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: You're stronger then they are, Josh. You are a living soul!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Get...off..me!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Dalton!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Dalton...?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Help me, dad...take this off me...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You're not really here. You're asleep in your bed in our home. Just stand up.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: He's going to hurt me again...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: This isn't real. You can do this.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: He's coming!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Just stand up!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Help him!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: ....ome....onnnnn...

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: They've made contact. I know it. He's found your son.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What happens now?

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: We need them to come back. We need him to find us.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: I want to get out!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: ....eeeeet out!

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Call out to him!

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Listen!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Follow my voice. Come back to us.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Put me down, I can run!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Go! I'm right behind you!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Find us!

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Check on the boy!

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: He's awake!

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Mom...

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Find me, Josh! Now! Wake up!

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Josh? Josh?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Dalton...?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: I don't know what to say...

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Well put.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Now this is worth dying for.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: I guess you did some pretty awesome stuff in there. You deserve some credit.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: You did good too in an assistant- type way.

Speaker: tucker
Dialogue: Thanks, boss.

Speaker: specs
Dialogue: Yeah.  Not the main selling point, but definitely important, for sure.

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: I'm tired.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Too bad. I'm never letting you go to sleep again.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You introduced me to a new world.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: No. You've been there before, remember? And you'll go back.  All of us will...eventually.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Maybe I can forget again.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Nothing, I...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What's the matter, Elise?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: What was that?  Stay here.

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Elise, what was that noise?

Speaker: renai
Dialogue: Elise, what happened? You're scaring me, tell me where Josh is?

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: You introduced me to a new world.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: No. You've been there before, remember? And you'll go back.  All of us will...eventually.

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Maybe I can forget again.

Speaker: elise
Dialogue: Nothing, I...

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: What's the matter, Elise?

Speaker: dalton
Dialogue: Put me down, I can run!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Go! I'm right behind you!

Speaker: josh
Dialogue: Get away the fuck away from me. I'm not scared of you, just leave me alone! Get away from me!
